alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 9:55AM CST until January 02 at 6:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. .The river is currently above minor flood stage, but is falling and is forecasted to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. For the Tchefuncte River...including Folsom, U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Sunday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM CST Sunday was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 12.6 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 11/15/1961. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
